Description: Papyrus fragment bearing 3 lines of a Coptic text written along the fibres (recto). EA 75325, 75324, 75323, 75322, 75321 are mounted together.
Curator's comments: Provenance: this fragment may have been written by a psalmodist from a monastery of Apa Apollo; a Hermopolite context is suggested by the acquisition details.
Bibliographic references: Clackson 2000 / Coptic and Greek Texts relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo (p.12, 138, pl.47)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (86612) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/86612)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Monastery of Apa Apollo
